decks.notes: The deck utilizes the combination of Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate to quickly reanimate powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Atraxa, Grand Unifier from the graveyard. It also includes cards like Solitude and Prismatic Ending for removal and disruption, as well as Faithful Mending for card draw and recursion. The inclusion of Thoughtseize and Force of Negation helps protect the combo pieces from disruption, while cards like Psychic Frog and Quantum Riddler provide additional value and control options. The deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and disruptive spells.

The deck focuses on utilizing fast, efficient creatures and burn spells to overwhelm the opponent quickly. It includes cards that buff creatures, generate tokens, and deal direct damage to the opponent. The mana base is built to support a mix of white and red spells, with some utility lands to further enhance the deck's strategy. The inclusion of cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury ensure a constant stream of threats that can quickly close out the game. The deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain momentum throughout the match.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and spells, utilizing cards like Ephemerate and Voice of Victory to gain an advantage. The key strategy is to maintain a fast pace and keep the pressure on the opponent with efficient creatures like Guide of Souls and Solitude, while also having access to removal spells like Galvanic Discharge and Thraben Charm. The deck capitalizes on synergy between creatures and enchantments, with Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Ocelot Pride providing additional support. The mana base is designed for consistency and speed, ensuring that the deck can execute its game plan effectively.

This deck focuses on disrupting and controlling the opponent's game plan through a combination of counterspells, removal, and hand disruption. It aims to maintain board control and limit the opponent's resources while gradually building up its own win condition. The deck utilizes a variety of control tools such as Force of Negation, Thoughtseize, Counterspell, and Fatal Push to keep the opponent in check. Additionally, it includes creatures like Murktide Regent and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares to provide a solid threat that can close out the game once the opponent's resources have been exhausted.

This deck focuses on utilizing artifact creatures and artifacts to generate fast mana advantage and overwhelm opponents with a large number of threats early in the game. The key strategy is to play cheap artifacts to enable cards with affinity for artifacts or Metalcraft abilities, allowing for explosive plays and efficient card draw. By combining aggression with card advantage, the deck aims to outpace and outvalue opponents in the early game, putting pressure on them to keep up or risk falling behind.

The main idea of this deck is to utilize the Amulet of Vigor to untap lands and generate mana quickly, allowing you to play big threats like Primeval Titan and win through combo with cards like Scapeshift. The deck also includes utility lands like Boseiju, Who Endures and Bojuka Bog to support the combo strategy. Additionally, cards like Summoner's Pact and Green Sun's Zenith help find the key pieces you need to win. Overall, the deck focuses on ramping quickly and assembling powerful combos to overwhelm your opponent.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on disruption and card advantage, utilizing a combination of hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize, counterspells like Counterspell, and removal spells like Fatal Push. The deck also includes creatures like Psychic Frog and Quantum Riddler to control the board and generate advantage. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides card draw and card selection. The mana base includes a mix of fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistent mana access. Overall, the deck aims to control the game through disruption and card advantage until it can secure a win condition.

This deck focuses on generating mana quickly with cards like Ruby Medallion, Manamorphose, and Pyretic Ritual to cast spells like Ral, Monsoon Mage and Glimpse the Impossible to deal damage to the opponent. By using cards like Past in Flames and Reckless Impulse, the deck aims to maximize its resources and combo off with cards like Grapeshot to finish the game. The deck also includes some land manipulation with cards like Valakut Awakening and Wrenn's Resolve to ensure consistency and draw power. Overall, the deck is designed to create explosive turns and overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of spells.

This deck focuses on using artifact creatures and spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent and win through aggressive tactics. It heavily relies on cards that generate mana and draw cards, allowing for a fast and consistent game plan. The key strategy is to deploy threats early on and keep the pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan with cards like Engineered Explosives and Metallic Rebuke. By utilizing the synergy between artifacts and creatures, this deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver opponents in a fast-paced, aggressive playstyle.

The deck focuses on aggressive creature plays combined with disruptive and removal spells to control the opponent's board while steadily applying pressure. It aims to quickly establish a strong board presence and disrupt the opponent's game plan through interaction and resource denial. The inclusion of powerful creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Emperor of Bones, along with versatile spells like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push, allows for a proactive and adaptable approach to winning the game efficiently. The deck also utilizes various lands to support its aggressive strategy and provide flexibility in mana usage.

The main idea behind this deck is to quickly drop low-cost artifacts onto the battlefield to power up cards like Mox Opal and Mishra's Bauble. By doing so, you can generate mana and card advantage to overwhelm your opponent with a flurry of artifacts and creatures. This aggressive strategy is further supported by cards like Metallic Rebuke and Engineered Explosives to control the board and disrupt your opponent's game plan. With the right combination of artifacts and instant-speed spells, you can quickly take control of the game and secure a swift victory.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful combat tricks. The deck includes key cards like Ajani, Guide of Souls, Ragavan, and Phlage to apply early pressure and finish off opponents efficiently. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Goblin Bombardment and Static Prison to control the board and protect its creatures. Overall, the strategy revolves around maintaining a fast-paced, aggressive playstyle to outpace and outmaneuver opponents in a Modern 1 vs 1 format.

The core theme of this deck is to quickly and efficiently assemble the necessary pieces to ramp up mana and cheat out powerful threats like Primeval Titan. By utilizing cards like Amulet of Vigor, Scapeshift, and Urza's Saga, the deck aims to generate explosive plays and overwhelm the opponent with giant creatures and potent abilities. The various lands and ramp spells work in harmony to set up the combo pieces, allowing the deck to quickly establish a dominant board presence and close out games before the opponent has a chance to react.

The main idea of this UW Control deck is to control the game by countering opponents' spells, removing threats, and drawing cards. It aims to stall the game until it can establish a dominant board presence with powerful sorceries like Supreme Verdict and creatures like Solitude. Using cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset, Parter of Veils, the deck can disrupt opponents' strategies and advance its own game plan. The deck also includes versatile removal options like Prismatic Ending and counterspells like Counterspell to stay in control of the game.

This deck focuses on quickly establishing a board presence while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Path to Exile and Sanctifier en-Vec. By utilizing powerful creatures like Solitude and Witch Enchanter, along with efficient removal options, the deck aims to pressure the opponent and control the game tempo. The inclusion of cards like Ephemerate and Guide of Souls allows for additional value and flexibility in combat and card advantage. Overall, the deck combines aggressive threats with disruptive elements to create a potent and versatile strategy in Modern 1 vs 1 matches.

This deck focuses on quickly developing a board presence with cheap artifact creatures and utilizing artifacts to gain advantages in the form of card draw and mana ramp. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggression and disruption, using cards like Mishra's Bauble and Mox Opal to generate card advantage and mana acceleration. With efficient threats like Memnite and Kappa Cannoneer, combined with the ability to protect them with Metallic Rebuke, this deck aims to put pressure on the opponent while controlling the game tempo.
